required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Ibuprofen (IBU) 250mg/APAP 500mg In The Treatment Of Post-Surgical Dental Pain
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Double-Blind, Randomized Safety And Efficacy Study Comparing Multiple Administrations Of IBU 250 Mg/APAP 500 Mg (Administered As Two Tablets Of IBU/APAP 125 Mg/250 Mg) To Placebo In The Treatment Of Post Surgical Dental Pain In Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being conducted to determine the overall analgesic efficacy and safety of a fixed-dose ibuprofen 250 mg / acetaminophen 500 mg formulation compared to placebo in subjects who are experiencing post operative pain following surgical extraction of 3 or more third molar teeth. A review of any reported adverse events will also be completed.

primary_outcome.description: • SPID [11] (sum of pain intensity difference scores) from 0 24 hours (time weighted sum of PID[11] scores based on the 11 point numerical Pain Severity Rating [PSR] scale).

secondary_outcome.description: • SPID [11] (time weighted sum of Pain Intensity Difference scores PID[11] based on the 11 point Numerical PSR scale) from 0 8, 6 8, 0 16, and 0 48 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of relief after first dose
secondary_outcome.description: • Duration of relief after first dose, as measured by the time from first dose to rescue medication or second dose whichever occurs first.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to onset of "meaningful" relief for the first dose
secondary_outcome.description: • Time to onset of "meaningful" relief for the first dose.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Fixed Dose Combination(FDC) IBU/APAP 250 mg/500 mg

intervention.arm_group_label: Fixed Dose Combination(FDC) IBU/APAP 250 mg/500 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
1. Males and females 18 years to 40 years of age (inclusive).
2. Outpatients who have undergone surgical extraction of 3 or more third molars, of which at least 2 must be a partial or complete bony mandibular impaction.
3. Subject must have at least moderate pain on the 4 point categorical scale, confirmed by at least 50 mm on the 100 mm VAS PSR scale within approximately 5 hours (ie, less than or equal to 5 hours, 15 minutes) after surgery is completed.
4. In general good health and have no contraindications to the study or rescue medication.
Exclusion Criteria
1. Presence or history of any significant hepatic, renal, endocrine, cardiovascular, neurological, psychiatric, gastrointestinal, pulmonary, hematologic, or metabolic disorder determined by the Investigator to place the subject at increased risk, including the presence or history within 2 years of screening of the following medical conditions/disorders:
- Gastrointestinal ulcer or gastrointestinal bleeding;
- Paralytic ileus or other gastrointestinal obstructive disorders;
- Bleeding disorder.
2. Hypersensitivity to ibuprofen, naproxen, aspirin, or any other NSAID; or to APAP, tramadol, other opioids, or to their combinations.
3. Prior use of any type of analgesic or NSAID within five half lives of that drug or less before taking the first dose of investigational product, except for pre anesthetic medication and anesthesia for the procedure.
